blocks.text: Time fractures. You see through the cracks — not one future, but many, layered like stained glass. Most are dark, fragmented, impossible to read. But one shines clear: a ruined Ministorum chapel deep in the underhive. Black candles burning with warp-flame. Chains bolted to the walls. And bound to those chains — psykers, their mouths forced open, singing a song that makes reality bleed.

At the center stands a figure. You cannot see their face, but you see their hands — covered in hexagrammic tattoos, moving in patterns that shape the psychic chorus like a conductor. This is the Choirmaster. And behind them, something vast and hungry presses against the membrane of reality, drawn by the song.
Emperor preserve us. You saw the Choir. You saw the thing they're summoning. I have felt that same presence pressing against the veil. We have less time than the Inquisitor believes.
blocks.speaker: Astropath Seren

choices.text: You have seen what awaits — and what the cult is trying to bring through.
